title: Shattered Glass
creator_credit: Cruise/Wagner Productions, Baumgarten Merims Productions, Forest Park Pictures, Renée April, Craig Baumgarten, Billy Ray, Adam Merims, François Séguin, Gaye Hirsch, Buzz Bissinger and Tove Christensen
headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2003
brief_description: The true story of fraudulent Washington, D.C. journalist Stephen Glass, who rose to meteoric heights as a young writer in his 20s, becoming a staff writer at The New Republic for three years. Looking for a short cut to fame, Glass concocted sources, quotes and even entire stories, but his deception did not go unnoticed forever, and eventually, his world came crumbling down.

constellations_other.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_other.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.
